gameMembers

Class Alert

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
      • gameMembers.Alert

  • public class Alert
extends Drawable
    The Alert class is a Drawable object that displays a message on the screen.
    Temporary messages can be set to display for a short amount of frames and then go back to the permanent message.
    Author:
    Hughes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Alert(float x, float y, java.lang.String s)
      Sets a new message at location x,y and with a value of s.
      The only constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
      This method is required to be implemented by any class that inherits it.
      void setCurrentMessage(java.lang.String currentMessage)
      Sets the current permanent message of the alert
      void setTempMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Sets a temporary message for the Alert.
      This message will display for a few frames and then the message will go back to being the permanent message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Alert

        public Alert(float x,
             float y,
             java.lang.String s)
        Sets a new message at location x,y and with a value of s.
        The only constructor for the class.
        Parameters:
        x - the x location
        y - the y location
        s - the String value of the alert (initially)

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: Drawable
        This method is required to be implemented by any class that inherits it. This allows draw to be called on a generic Drawable[].

        Implementation of this method should involve putting a graphical representation of the class on the screen in some way.

        An example of how to draw:

        g.drawImage(this.getImage());

        Specified by:
        draw in class Drawable
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object passed in from the class that has a draw method. This allows the object to draw itself

      • setCurrentMessage

        public void setCurrentMessage(java.lang.String currentMessage)
        Sets the current permanent message of the alert
        Parameters:
        currentMessage - the new message

      • setTempMessage

        public void setTempMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets a temporary message for the Alert.
        This message will display for a few frames and then the message will go back to being the permanent message.
        Parameters:
        message - the temporary message
